Constructor Detail

Game

public Game(int mode,
            javax.swing.JLabel label)
The Game(int mode) constructor takes the mode as a parameter and creates a new game object, instantiating the correct AI depending on the mode picked. Mode 0 denotes Player vs. Player, mode 1 is Captain Random, and mode 2 is MinMax.

Parameters:
mode -

Game

public Game(int mode,
            java.lang.String playerOneName,
            java.lang.String playerTwoName,
            javax.swing.JLabel label)
Method Detail

getAI

public AI getAI()
The getAI() method returns the AI object playing in the current game. This method should only be called for modes that involve an AI player

Returns:
player, the AI playing the game

getVictory

public boolean getVictory()
The getVictory() method checks the state of the victory variable and returns it. a value of true means that victory has been achived by a player and false means that no player has won the game

Returns:
true if game has been won, false if it has not

getMode

public int getMode()
The getMode() method returns the mode that the game is being played in.

Returns:
the mode of the game, 0 if the game is Player vs. Player, 1 if the game is Captain Random, and 2 if the game is MinMax

getTurn

public boolean getTurn()
The getTurn() method returns the player who's turn it is.

Returns:
the color of the player who's turn it is, false if it is white, true if it is black

changeTurn

public void changeTurn()
The changeTurn() method changes whoever's turn it is. If it is black's turn, changeTurn() will change it to white's and vice versa. False means white, true means black. the changeTurn method also rewrites a JLabel that says who's turn it is.

checkVictory

public void checkVictory(Board b)
The checkVictory(Board b) method takes a board as a parameter and checks if the game has been won. The method iterates through the board it is passed, and if a king is found, victory is set to false, otherwise, the victory variable defaults to true.

Parameters:
b -
